questionData.explanation_of_Question: This text has run-on sentences and punctuation issues. The first two clauses need proper separation (e.g., semicolon or new sentence). 'Which' should be 'that' or omitted in a restrictive clause. 'In' is not the correct preposition with 'arrive home'; no preposition is needed. 'Very exciting' should be 'really exciting' or similar, as 'so' usually introduces a consequence clause.
questionData.instruction: Correct the punctuation, sentence structure, article usage, and word choice errors in the paragraph.
questionData.original_text: The train was delayed by two hours I finally arrive home at midnight which was very tired I was so exciting to see my family again.
standard_corrections: The train was delayed by two hours; I finally arrived home at midnight. I was very tired. I was so excited to see my family again.
The train was delayed by two hours. I finally arrived home at midnight, which made me very tired. I was really excited to see my family again.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 'Child' is singular, but 'were' is plural; it should be 'child was'. 'Run' is incorrect for talking about a company; 'operate' or 'manage' is more appropriate. 'Last year' indicates past tense, so 'operate' should be 'operated'. 'Many' is used with countable nouns; 'a lot of' or 'much' would be better for 'money', but 'invested significantly' or similar might be better phrasing.
questionData.instruction: Find and correct the errors in singular/plural forms, subject-verb agreement, verb tense, and word choice.
questionData.original_text: One child in the class were absent yesterday. My uncle run a small company which operate last year. He invested many money on new equipment.
standard_corrections: One child in the class was absent yesterday. My uncle runs a small company which operated last year. He invested a lot of money in new equipment.
One child in the class was absent yesterday. My uncle runs a small company which was operated last year. He invested significantly in new equipment.

questionData.explanation_of_Question: 'Important' needs 'an' before it. 'On the next week' should be 'next week' (no preposition). 'Will discussing' is incorrect; it should be 'will discuss' (future simple) or 'will be discussing' (future continuous). 'Look forward to meet' requires the -ing form after 'to' when 'to' is a preposition expressing a destination or object (here, the object of the anticipation), so it should be 'looking forward to meeting'.
questionData.instruction: Correct the article usage, prepositions, verb tenses, and word choice errors in the email excerpt.
questionData.original_text:
Subject: About Meeting

Dear John,

I want to arrange important meeting with you on the next week. We will discussing the project proposal. I look forward to meet you then.

Best regards,
Sarah
standard_corrections:
Subject: About Meeting

Dear John,

I want to arrange an important meeting with you next week. We will discuss the project proposal. I look forward to meeting you then.

Best regards,
Sarah

Subject: About Meeting

Dear John,

I would like to arrange an important meeting with you next week. We will be discussing the project proposal. I look forward to meeting you then.

Best regards,
Sarah
